intro: Chomelia congensis, commonly known as the Congo chomelia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and West Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
